first-steps.title: Welcome to {appName}
first-steps.preamble:
Just add a new note by clicking on the **plus icon** in the **lower right corner**.

There are different types of notes.

text.title: Text
text.help: This is a simple text note. If you copy this note you the shown text is copied. It is also possible to write the content in **Markdown**.

reminder.title: Reminder
reminder.help: This is a note with a date. When this date expires, you will be notified.

template.title: Template
template.help: This is a note where you can define a template (text) and placeholders. When you copy the contents of this note, you are prompted to fill in these placeholders. Then the template is copied with the **replaced** placeholders. This type is ideal for command line commands.

validation.invalid-character: It must start with a letter and must only contains numbers and letters!

picture.title: Picture
picture.help: This is a note in which you can store a **Image URL**. The image will be displayed and when you copy the content, you copy the URL of that image. This type is ideal for storing **[reaction GIFs](https://giphy.com/search/developer)** :)

camera.title: Photo
camera.help: This is a note in which you can take a photo and save a corresponding description.

record.title: Record
record.help: This is a note in which you can save a voice recording and a corresponding description.

credentials.title: Credentials
credentials.help: This is a note for credentials. Here you can save username and password. It is recommended to do this only if **encryption is enabled**! Encryption can be enabled in the settings area.

warn.decrypted: Warning: Your notes are stored unencrypted! It is recommended never to save passwords in plain text! In the settings area you can enable the encryption.

all.confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete all this notes?

delete.trash: The note was moved to trash.
delete.confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this note?

help.title: Dashboard help
help.content:
Notes may contain **tags**. These tags can be used to **filter** notes. To avoid you having to set these filters every time dashboards can be created.

Dashboards are a collection of filters. They have a **name**, an **icon** and are displayed in the **menu bar**. This way **categories** or frequently used filters can be created.

delete.confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this dashboard?

encryption.title: Encryption
encryption.insecure: Warning: Your password will be stored unencrypted! It is recommended never to save passwords in plain text! In the settings area you can enable the encryption.

warn.decrypted: Warning: Your credentials are stored unencrypted! It is recommended never to save passwords in plain text! In the settings area you can enable the encryption.

error.invalid: The user does not have the required rights or does not exists.
error.general: The file could not be exported! Error: {err}

error.invalid: The user does not have the required rights or does not exists.
error.not-found: The file could not be found.
error.general: The file could not be imported! Error: {err}

help.title: Github - gist help
help.content:
In order to be able to use storage by [gist](https://gist.github.com/), precautions must be taken:
### Create access token
In order for DevNotes to be able to use the gist API, an access token must first be created. Go to **Settings => Developer settings**. Then a new token can be generated under **Personal access tokens**.
### Select Gist
After you have entered the access token, you can select a gist. You can either select *an existing*, *a new* or *a foreign* gist.

warn.decrypted: Warning: Your access token will be stored unencrypted! It is recommended never to save passwords in plain text! In the settings area you can enable the encryption.

error.forbidden: The export to this gist is not allowed.
error.general: The file could not be exported! Error: {err}
The file could not be imported! Error: {err}

warn.decrypted: Warning: Your credentials are stored unencrypted! It is recommended never to save passwords in plain text! In the settings area you can enable the encryption.

help.title: AWS - S3 help
help.content:
To use the [S3-Service](https://aws.amazon.com/s3/) provided by [Amazon Web Services](https://aws.amazon.com/) (AWS), the following precautions must be taken:
### 1. Create an AWS user
It will recommend creating a dedicated user for S3 access. To do this, go into [Identity and Access Management (IAM)](https://aws.amazon.com/iam/) and create a new user. The access type should be set to **programmatic access**.
### 2. Set the required rights
In order for the user to use the S3 service, he must be [given](https://aws.amazon.com/iam/details/manage-permissions/) the correct rights. To do this, select the desired user and assign it to the predefined **policy** named **AmazonS3FullAccess**.
### 3. Create access key
For DevNotes to use the S3 service, an [access key](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_credentials_access-keys.html) must be created for the user.
### 4. Create S3 bucket
In a bucket, files can be stored. Set up a [new bucket](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/de_de/AmazonS3/latest/dev/UsingBucket.html#create-bucket-intro). It should be noted that the *public access* may **not** be blocked!
### 5. CORS configuration
The default settings of an S3 bucket deny any access outside the Amazon cloud! For DevNotes to save / load files, a CORS configuration must [be set](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/cors.html#how-do-i-enable-cors). You can copy the following configuration:
```xml
<CORSConfiguration xmlns="http://s3.amazonaws.com/doc/2006-03-01/">
<CORSRule>
    <AllowedOrigin>{corsOrigin}</AllowedOrigin>
    <AllowedMethod>HEAD</AllowedMethod>
    <AllowedMethod>GET</AllowedMethod>
    <AllowedMethod>PUT</AllowedMethod>
    <AllowedMethod>POST</AllowedMethod>
    <AllowedMethod>DELETE</AllowedMethod>
    <ExposeHeader>ETag</ExposeHeader>
    <ExposeHeader>x-amz-meta-custom-header</ExposeHeader>
    <AllowedHeader>*</AllowedHeader>
</CORSRule>
</CORSConfiguration>
```

error.forbidden: The user does not have the required rights.
error.general: The file could not be exported! Error: {err}

error.forbidden: The user does not have the required rights.

warn.decrypted: Warning: Your access token will be stored unencrypted! It is recommended never to save passwords in plain text! In the settings area you can enable the encryption.

The file could not be imported! Error: {err}

help.title: Encryption help
help.content:
The data is stored on your device! It is explicitly **not** stored on a server. Nevertheless, by default it is stored **unencrypted** - and thus in readable form. If you do not want this, you can have the data encrypted. As a result, the notes and other sensible data are safe even if you lose the device!

To encrypt the data, you need a (good) **password**. From now on, you must enter it when starting the application.

**ATTENTION:** If you lose the password, your data **can not** be recovered! Because the password **is not** saved!.

It is no problem if you already have some unencrypted notes! These can also be encrypted later. The reverse is also true: you can have your data stored in decrypted form and you do not have to enter a password at the start from then on!
